API Platform Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(13) API all the Things!

  • Increasing number of API-enabled capabilities
  • Increasing consumption of API-enabled capabilities
  • Increasing complexity of API footprint and requirements
  • One-size-fits-all API management is on its way out


API Platform Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(14) Inside-Out: External API Consumers

  • The origin of the term API as we use it today
  • Partners: Driving your business by scaling partnerships (think eBay [Type 2: API/Dev Platform Needed (1)])
  • Customers: Driving your business by digitizing customer interactions
  • Portals are outward-facing and should be business-case centered


API Platform Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(15) Inside-In: Internal API Platform

  • Driven by the need to decrease coupling
  • Driven by the need to increase flow
  • Part of many stories around digital transformation (think Amazon API Mandate)


API Platform Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(16) Outside-In: Digital Supply Chain Management

  • Currently not the focus of most portal products and strategies
  • Probably a growing area of concern with increasing dependencies and complexity
  • Should become part of the general Platform Engineering [Platform Engineering (1)] approach


Developer Platform

Outline (Developer Platform)

Developer Platform Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(18) Developer Platform

  • API Platform [API Platform (1)] but probably a different set of APIs
  • Support for specific consumption (beyond generic SDKs)
  • Support for API production (think Amazon API Mandate)
  • Many organizations now have/create specific platform teams


Developer Platform Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(19) Team Topologies: Team Types

Source: Matthew Skelton and Manuel Pais, "Team Topologies: Organizing Business and Technology Teams for Fast Flow", IT Revolution, September 2019

The Business of Platforms Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(22) Become Platform-y

  • Most businesses are not (primarily) platform businesses
  • Many businesses can benefit from adding a platform angle
  • Explore API Business Models [https://www.mulesoft.com/sites/default/files/cmm_files/2020_Guide_to_API_Business_Models.pdf] for some inspiration


The Business of Platforms Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(29) The 900lb Gorilla



The Business of Platforms Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(30) Most API Value Creation is Indirect

  1. Using APIs to become better at internal reuse and cross-pollination
  2. Reducing friction by having teams communicate via APIs
  3. Using API First as a way to build everything as digital building blocks

(32) Platforms and Innovation



Platform Engineering Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(33) From Waterfall to Platform

  • Waterfall: Good for assembly line but not so good at allowing feedback
  • DevOps: Deals well with feedback but does not address scaling challenges
  • Platform Engineering: Allows teams to outsource non-differentiating tasks to the platform

(38) Improving Platform Engineering

Source: CNCF Platform Engineering Maturity Model



Platform Engineering Maturity Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(39) Maturity Model Usage

  • End Users: Structured view of practices and changing from reactive to strategic
  • Vendors: Decide on product sweet spot and explaining to customers
  • Consultants: Identify state and goal and areas of investment

Building API Platforms Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(44) API Platform Specifics

  • Targeting specific consumer group(s)
  • Not making any assumptions about consumption mechanics
  • APIs aligned with business capabilities and partner models

Connect the Platform Dots Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering

(46) Platform Questions

  • Are you a platform business?
    • No, and stop trying to be one.
  • Should you be building up your business platform?
    • Yes, and it should be driven by business considerations.
  • Do you need an API platform?
    • Likely so, and make sure it's useful for internal and external consumers.
  • Do you need an Internal Developer Platform (IDP)?
    • Likely so, if your business needs to adapt and evolve quickly.


Connect the Platform Dots Erik Wilde, OAI Ambassador: Platform Strategy and Engineering
